name: CreateSloReportJob
description:
Initiate the generation of an SLO report in Datadog.

Use this tool to start an SLO report job in Datadog. Once created, the job processes asynchronously, and a CSV report becomes available for download. Utilize the returned `report_id` to check status and access the report.

parameters.name: from_timestamp_epoch_seconds
parameters.description: The starting timestamp for the SLO report in epoch seconds. Specifies when the report should begin.

value_schema.description: The `from` timestamp for the report in epoch seconds.

parameters.name: slo_query_filter
parameters.description: The query string to filter SLO results, e.g., 'service:<service-name>' or 'slo-name'.

value_schema.description: The query string used to filter SLO results. Some examples of queries include `service:<service-name>` and `slo-name`.

parameters.name: report_to_timestamp
parameters.description: The epoch timestamp representing the end time for the SLO report.

value_schema.description: The `to` timestamp for the report in epoch seconds.

parameters.name: report_generation_frequency
parameters.description: The frequency for generating report data. Options: daily, weekly, monthly.

value_schema.description: The frequency at which report data is to be generated.

parameters.name: report_timezone
parameters.description: The timezone to determine the start and end of each interval for the SLO report. It affects how intervals such as weekly start at 12am on Sunday in the specified timezone.

value_schema.description: The timezone used to determine the start and end of each interval. For example, weekly intervals start at 12am on Sunday in the specified timezone.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Datadog API.

parameters.name: data.attributes.from_ts
parameters.description: The `from` timestamp for the report in epoch seconds.

value_schema.description: The `from` timestamp for the report in epoch seconds.

parameters.name: data.attributes.interval
parameters.description: The frequency at which report data is to be generated.

value_schema.description: The frequency at which report data is to be generated.

parameters.name: data.attributes.query
parameters.description: The query string used to filter SLO results. Some examples of queries include `service:<service-name>` and `slo-name`.

value_schema.description: The query string used to filter SLO results. Some examples of queries include `service:<service-name>` and `slo-name`.

parameters.name: data.attributes.timezone
parameters.description: The timezone used to determine the start and end of each interval. For example, weekly intervals start at 12am on Sunday in the specified timezone.

value_schema.description: The timezone used to determine the start and end of each interval. For example, weekly intervals start at 12am on Sunday in the specified timezone.

parameters.name: data.attributes.to_ts
parameters.description: The `to` timestamp for the report in epoch seconds.

value_schema.description: The `to` timestamp for the report in epoch seconds.
